content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Extraction system at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of:
– Burner inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)

### Copper cable factory interface at Position(x≈2.5–3.5, y≈16.5–17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) (placed using direction RIGHT)
– Burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) (retrieved as new factory burner inserter)
– Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Belt depot system at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
– Wooden chest serving as belt depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
– Transport belt segment placed adjacent at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) (using direction UP)

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• When connecting transport belts, the target is mistakenly interpreted as a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always ensure the connection is made to a valid inserter (one that feeds items into the intended entity) rather than directly to a steam engine.
• When placing an entity such as a wooden chest, errors due to excessive distance have occurred. Move closer to the intended target position before placing to remain within the maximum placement range.
• If an entity placement fails because the item is missing from inventory, verify that the required item is available before attempting the placement.
• Variable reference errors (e.g. “target_chest is not defined”) indicate that all identifiers must be correctly defined and referenced prior to use.
